intro: Pteroptychia dalziellii, commonly known as the Dalziell's pterostichus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
